summary: Neon nights, ramen crawls, and zen gardens all inside one transit swipe.

paceNotes.chill: Swap a museum for an onsen soak and keep mornings slow with third-wave coffee.
paceNotes.balanced: Mix headline sights with neighborhood wanders and leave evenings open for ramen cues.
paceNotes.energetic: Add late-night jazz bars, early market runs, and quick Shinkansen day trips.

highlights: Day trip to Nikko or Hakone

days.title: Arrival & Shinjuku glow

schedule.morning: Land, drop bags near Shinjuku or Shibuya, and reset with a walk through the Meiji Shrine forest.
schedule.afternoon: Browse Harajuku side streets, Omotesando architecture, and book teamLab Planets for an immersive art stop.
schedule.evening: Head to the Shinjuku Metropolitan Building for dusk panoramas then graze through Omoide Yokocho yakitori alleys.

meals: Dinner: Yakitori tasting in Omoide Yokocho
days.notes: If your flight lands late, pivot to a casual ramen crawl instead.

days.title: Tsukiji dawn & Asakusa

schedule.morning: Arrive early to Tsukiji outer market for tamagoyaki, tuna bowls, and kitchenware shopping.
schedule.afternoon: Ride the Ginza line to Sensō-ji, explore Nakamise street snacks, then cruise the Sumida River south.
schedule.evening: Cross to Akihabara arcades or book a tea ceremony near Ueno for a calmer close.

days.notes: Grab a 24-hour metro pass if you expect 4+ rides today.

days.title: Modern Tokyo loop

schedule.morning: Check out contemporary art in Roppongi (Mori Art Museum) before coffee at Toranomon Hills.
schedule.afternoon: Take the monorail to Odaiba, walk the seaside park, and time a sunset ferry back toward Tokyo Tower.
schedule.evening: Do the Shibuya Sky observatory then people-watch at the scramble and end with cocktails in Golden Gai.

meals: Dessert: Taiyaki along Odaiba Seaside Park
days.notes: Reserve Shibuya Sky weeks ahead during peak seasons.

days.title: Day trip flex

schedule.morning: Take the Romancecar to Hakone or the JR Nikko line for cedar forests and lake cruises.
schedule.afternoon: Enjoy onsen baths, ropeway volcano views, or Nikko's ornate Toshogu Shrine complexes.
schedule.evening: Return to Tokyo in time for izakaya comfort food near your hotel.

meals: Dinner: Cozy izakaya near your station
days.notes: Reserve day-trip rail seats the day prior at any JR ticket office.

days.title: Creative set

schedule.morning: Browse design studios in Daikanyama and pick up souvenirs at T-Site.
schedule.afternoon: Head to Shimokitazawa thrift shops or Kichijoji for Ghibli Museum ticket (book months ahead).
schedule.evening: Wrap with a jazz set in Shibuya or Nakameguro canal stroll if you're keeping things easy.

days.notes: Check the live-house schedule for intimate shows (Blue Note, Cotton Club).

flexDays.title: Yokohama harbour day

schedule.morning: Ride 30 minutes south to Yokohama to tour the Cup Noodles Museum and Red Brick Warehouse.
schedule.afternoon: Picnic in Yamashita Park then wander Chinatown for dim sum tastings.
schedule.evening: Return for a calm onsen soak at Thermae-Yu back in Shinjuku.

flexDays.notes: Pair with rooftop bar reservations if you still have energy.

flexDays.title: Studio Ghibli inspired loop

schedule.morning: Take the train to Mitaka for the Ghibli Museum (pre-book timed entry).
schedule.afternoon: Continue to Kichijoji's Inokashira Park boating lake and indie cafes.
schedule.evening: Browse Nakano Broadway collectibles then dinner at a kissaten jazz cafe.

flexDays.notes: Museum tickets release monthly and sell out within hours.

localTips: Load an IC transit card (Suica/PASMO) before leaving the airport.
Most ramen counters are walk-in; buy a ticket at the vending machine first.
Convenience stores stock excellent grab-and-go breakfasts for early departures.

summary: Hilltop views, tiled facades, and day trips to pastel palaces on the Atlantic breeze.

paceNotes.chill: Scatter miradouros with long espresso stops and keep afternoons light.
paceNotes.balanced: Blend tram hops with waterfront walks and sunset fado shows.
paceNotes.energetic: Stack a Sintra or Cascais day trip plus late-night Bairro Alto.

highlights: Pastéis de Belém warm from the oven
Sintra's Pena Palace and Quinta da Regaleira
Sunset at Miradouro da Senhora do Monte

days.title: Baixa & Alfama

schedule.morning: Ride Elevador de Santa Justa for the lay of the land, then wander Baixa squares.
schedule.afternoon: Climb Alfama's lanes toward Castelo de São Jorge, pausing at miradouros for tile-lined vistas.
schedule.evening: Book a fado dinner in Alfama or Mouraria for soulful guitar sets.

meals: Lunch: Tinned fish tasting at Sol e Pesca
days.notes: Wear shoes with grip—Alfama's cobblestones tilt sharply.

days.title: Belém & riverfront

schedule.morning: Catch Tram 15 to Belém for Jerónimos Monastery and the Discoveries Monument.
schedule.afternoon: Tour MAAT's contemporary curves, then ferry back for LX Factory creatives and azulejo workshops.
schedule.evening: Watch sunset at Time Out Market's rooftop then share petiscos at the hall.

meals: Dinner: Petiscos crawl at Time Out Market
days.notes: Pre-book Jerónimos tickets online to skip the queue.

days.title: Sintra adventure

schedule.morning: Train to Sintra, head straight to Pena Palace for fairy-tale towers before crowds arrive.
schedule.afternoon: Descend through Quinta da Regaleira tunnels and lunch in the village. Uber to Cabo da Roca cliffs if weather cooperates.
schedule.evening: Return to Lisbon for sunset drinks along the Ribeira das Naus promenade.

days.notes: Use the Sintra bus 434 loop to avoid steep climbs between sites.

days.title: Modern Lisbon

schedule.morning: Explore Príncipe Real boutiques and farmers market (weekends).
schedule.afternoon: Head to Parque das Nações for oceanarium visits or rent bikes along the flat waterfront.
schedule.evening: Close out in Bairro Alto with rooftop bars or intimate vinyl bars in Cais do Sodré.

days.notes: Many shops close mid-afternoon on Sundays—plan markets earlier.

flexDays.title: Cascais coastal loop

schedule.morning: Train to Cascais for boardwalk walks and museum visits (Casa das Histórias Paula Rego).
schedule.afternoon: Bike west to Boca do Inferno cliffs and Guincho Beach dunes.
schedule.evening: Return for seafood cataplana near Cais do Sodré.

flexDays.notes: Winds pick up after 3pm—pack layers for the ride.

flexDays.title: Tile & food workshop

schedule.morning: Take an azulejo painting workshop at a local studio near Graça.
schedule.afternoon: Join a pastel de nata baking class or market-to-table cooking school.
schedule.evening: Celebrate with sunset cocktails at Miradouro de Santa Catarina.

flexDays.notes: Workshops often sell out—reserve when you book flights.

localTips: Buy a Viva Viagem card for unlimited tram/bus rides on travel days.
Most restaurants serve bread, olives, and cheese automatically—politely decline to avoid charges.
Sunset viewpoints fill up; arrive 30 minutes early if you want a railing spot.

summary: Megalopolis energy with leafy barrios, world-class museums, and markets dripping with chile and citrus.

paceNotes.chill: Anchor in Condesa cafés, linger over mezcal tastings, and limit multi-museum days.
paceNotes.balanced: Pair historic core mornings with park walks and progressive dinners.
paceNotes.energetic: Add sunrise balloon rides, lucha libre nights, and Toluca volcano hikes.

days.title: Centro histórico

schedule.morning: Walk the Zócalo, Palacio Nacional murals, and Templo Mayor ruins.
schedule.afternoon: Tour Palacio de Bellas Artes then eat your way through Mercado de San Juan and La Ciudadela crafts.
schedule.evening: Catch a rooftop sunset drink above the cathedral before dinner in Roma.

meals: Lunch: Mercado de San Juan seafood tostadas
days.notes: Museums close Mondays—shuffle the schedule if needed.

days.title: Chapultepec & Polanco

schedule.morning: Wander Chapultepec Park, climb the castle, and visit the National Anthropology Museum.
schedule.afternoon: Grab churros, rent bikes along Reforma's Sunday ciclovía (if weekend), and window-shop Polanco's boutiques.
schedule.evening: Book an omakase or contemporary Mexican dinner around Masaryk.

days.notes: Reserve Anthropology Museum tickets online to skip onsite lines.

days.title: Coyoacán creatives

schedule.morning: Tour the Frida Kahlo Museum (Casa Azul) followed by coffee in leafy plazas.
schedule.afternoon: Visit Leon Trotsky's house, browse Mercado Coyoacán snacks, and pick up churros.
schedule.evening: Head to Xochimilco for a golden-hour trajinera ride with snacks and mariachi.

days.notes: Casa Azul tickets sell out quickly—book 2-3 weeks ahead.

days.title: Teotihuacan sunrise

schedule.morning: Leave at 4 am for a sunrise balloon flight above the pyramids followed by a guided site walk.
schedule.afternoon: Lunch at a cave restaurant near the site, then nap back in Condesa parks.
schedule.evening: Low-key taco crawl (al pastor, suadero, birria) along Avenida Tamaulipas.

days.notes: Bring layers—the valley is chilly before the sun hits.

days.title: Roma & Condesa

schedule.morning: Coffee crawl through Roma's third-wave spots and browse street art alleys.
schedule.afternoon: Shop Casa Bosques chocolates, Lardo bakery, and small galleries.
schedule.evening: Do a mezcal tasting before a chef's counter dinner then dance at a vinyl listening bar.

days.notes: Check local listings for pop-up design markets on weekends.

flexDays.title: Nevado de Toluca hike

schedule.morning: Drive 2 hours to the volcano crater and hike the twin lagoons loop.
schedule.afternoon: Picnic above the crater or stop in Toluca for chorizo tastings.
schedule.evening: Return early for a spa session or quiet dinner.

flexDays.notes: Altitude reaches 4,000m—acclimate in the city for a few days first.

flexDays.title: Puebla flavors

schedule.morning: Take the ADO bus to Puebla, explore the cathedral square and colorful talavera tile workshops.
schedule.afternoon: Taste mole poblano, cemitas, and sweets on Calle de los Dulces.
schedule.evening: Return to CDMX for rooftop drinks near the Monument to the Revolution.

flexDays.notes: Grab a seat on the upper level of the ADO bus for views of Popocatépetl volcano.

localTips: Carry small change for metro rides and market snacks—cards are not widely accepted.
Altitude is ~2,200m; drink extra water and pace alcohol nights early in the trip.
Use authorized taxi stands or app-based rides for late-night exits.

summary: Basecamp for waterfalls, lava fields, and cozy cafes under midnight sun or northern lights skies.

paceNotes.chill: Focus on geothermal pools and short scenic drives with long coffee shop stops.
paceNotes.balanced: Do a Golden Circle day plus a south coast loop and keep evenings for hot springs.
paceNotes.energetic: Layer glacier hikes, lava tunnels, and midnight aurora hunts.

days.title: Downtown orientation

schedule.morning: Walk Laugavegur's shops, visit Hallgrímskirkja tower for skyline views, and grab cinnamon buns at Brauð & Co.
schedule.afternoon: Tour the Sun Voyager sculpture and learn volcanic history at the Perlan museum.
schedule.evening: Book Sky Lagoon or local public pools for a geothermal soak at sunset.

days.notes: Reserve Sky Lagoon's 7-step ritual ahead of weekends.

days.title: Golden Circle

schedule.morning: Pick up your rental car, drive to Þingvellir National Park, and snorkel Silfra or hike the tectonic plates.
schedule.afternoon: Continue to Geysir geothermal area and Gullfoss waterfall, stopping for tomato soup at Friðheimar greenhouse.
schedule.evening: Return via Secret Lagoon or Fontana spa soak.

days.notes: Refuel in Selfoss—stations can be sparse deeper in the loop.

days.title: South coast expedition

schedule.morning: Drive to Seljalandsfoss waterfall (walk behind it) then continue to Skógafoss for rainbow sprays.
schedule.afternoon: Explore Reynisfjara black sand beach and basalt columns, detouring to Dyrhólaey cliffs if puffins are nesting.
schedule.evening: Stay overnight near Vík or head back for a late dinner in Reykjavik.

days.notes: Check road.is for weather closures, especially in winter.

days.title: Glaciers or aurora

schedule.morning: Choose a glacier hike on Sólheimajökull or a lava tunnel tour near Reykjavik.
schedule.afternoon: Return to town for coffeehouse hopping and design shopping.
schedule.evening: Join a guided northern lights jeep chase (winter) or midnight sun photo walk (summer).

meals: Lunch: Local soup served in bread bowls
days.notes: Guided tours bundle gear—no need to pack crampons unless self-driving on ice.

flexDays.title: Snæfellsnes peninsula

schedule.morning: Drive 2.5 hours to Snæfellsnes for Kirkjufell mountain shots and lava fields.
schedule.afternoon: Walk black church at Búðir, sample rye bread baked in hot springs at Laugarvatn.
schedule.evening: Stay in a countryside guesthouse for aurora chances.

flexDays.notes: Fuel up before the peninsula—services are limited.

flexDays.title: Westman Islands

schedule.morning: Ferry to Heimaey to see puffin colonies and hike Eldfell volcano.
schedule.afternoon: Visit the Beluga Whale Sanctuary and learn about the 1973 eruption.
schedule.evening: Return for seafood dinner back in Reykjavik.

flexDays.notes: Ferries are weather-dependent—keep backups in mind.

localTips: Pack layers even midsummer; winds change quickly.
Tap water is geothermal-heated—let it run cold before filling bottles.
Respect moss fields and stay on paths to protect fragile growth.

summary: Ocean air meets pine forests: cycle the seawall, eat through markets, and hop to nearby mountains.

paceNotes.chill: Stick to seawall rides, Granville Island tastings, and relaxed brewery hops.
paceNotes.balanced: Blend Stanley Park cycles with North Shore hikes and Gastown dinners.
paceNotes.energetic: Add Squamish gondola, Capilano canyoning, and dawn kayak paddles.

days.title: Seawall spin

schedule.morning: Rent bikes near Coal Harbour and ride the Stanley Park seawall clockwise for skyline + forest views.
schedule.afternoon: Picnic at Third Beach then visit the Vancouver Aquarium or totem poles.
schedule.evening: Return bikes, grab gelato on Denman Street, and catch sunset at English Bay.

days.notes: Counter-clockwise is pedestrian only—follow the bike arrows.

days.title: Granville & Gastown

schedule.morning: Take the Aquabus to Granville Island for market tastings and artisan studios.
schedule.afternoon: Explore Gastown design shops, steam clock, and Indigenous galleries.
schedule.evening: Craft cocktail crawl along Water Street or reserve a chef's counter.

days.notes: Snag theatre tickets at Granville Island for a spontaneous show.

days.title: North Shore nature

schedule.morning: Bus or drive to Capilano Suspension Bridge Park, exploring treetop walks and cliffwalks.
schedule.afternoon: Continue to Lynn Canyon free suspension bridge or hike Quarry Rock in Deep Cove.
schedule.evening: Reward yourself with craft beer in North Vancouver's Shipyards District.

days.notes: Arrive early at Capilano to beat bus tour crowds.

days.title: Choose-your-own coastal

schedule.morning: Kayak on False Creek or take a whale-watching cruise to spot orcas.
schedule.afternoon: Relax on Kitsilano Beach or visit the Museum of Anthropology at UBC.
schedule.evening: Dine along Yaletown patios with views of the seawall.

days.notes: Museum is temporarily closed Mondays—check current hours.

flexDays.title: Whistler alpine dash

schedule.morning: Drive the Sea-to-Sky Highway, stopping at Shannon Falls before reaching Whistler Village.
schedule.afternoon: Ride Peak 2 Peak gondola, hike alpine trails, or mountain bike the park.
schedule.evening: Return to Vancouver for late-night ramen.

flexDays.notes: Book a car-share early; buses fill on weekends.

flexDays.title: Sunshine Coast escape

schedule.morning: Ferry to Gibsons Landing, browse seaside shops, and grab pastries.
schedule.afternoon: Kayak calm coves or hike Soames Hill for Howe Sound views.
schedule.evening: Stay overnight or ferry back for sunset along the seawall.

flexDays.notes: Reserve ferry spots for cars; foot passengers can usually roll onboard.

localTips: Pack a light rain layer even in July—the forecast can change within hours.
Compass cards make public transit taps quick on SkyTrain, SeaBus, and buses.
Respect wildlife on trails—give black bears space and pack out trash.
